title: Intel Stands to Win $3.5 Billion to Produce Chips for Military
description: The US government is poised to invest $3.5 billion in Intel Corp. so the chipmaker can produce advanced semiconductors for military and intelligence programs, according to congressional aides.

title: Biden to Request 1% Increase in 2025 Defense Budget Under Cap
description: The Biden administration will request a 1% increase in defense spending, to $849.8 billion, for fiscal year 2025, officials familiar with the matter said, scaling back plans for a bigger boost as it grapples with caps imposed by last year’s debt-limit deal.

title: Senegal Sets March Presidential Vote Before End of Sall’s Term
description: Senegal’s government backed a new date for the country’s postponed presidential elections. set to take place before incumbent President Macky Sall is due to step down next month.

title: How Haiti’s New Crisis Traces to the Growing Power of Gangs
description: Haiti, the poorest country in the Americas and just 700 miles from Florida, has been mired in political turmoil and violence for decades. But the situation has deteriorated dramatically since the 2021 murder of President Jovenel Moise thrust Prime Minister Ariel Henry into power. Now, powerful gangs have taken over large swathes of the nation, freeing thousands of prison inmates and driving up homicide and kidnapping rates in a country where almost half the population goes hungry. With elections

title: Biden and Trump Carry Key Weaknesses Into Their Election Fight
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Washington correspondent Saleha Mohsin discusses for her podcast the state of the Biden and Trump campaigns. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Chicago Mayor’s ‘Mansion Tax’ Back on Ballot After Court Ruling
description: A contentious measure proposed by Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson to increase taxes on real estate transactions of $1 million or more is officially back on the March 19 ballot.

title: US House Approves $460 Billion Bill Ahead of Shutdown Deadline
description: The US House approved a $460 billion spending bill, sending it to the Senate where it’s expected to pass in time to avert a Saturday partial government shutdown.

title: Peru to Revive Senate 30 Years After Fujimori Abolished It
description: Peru’s fragmented congress formed a supermajority to resuscitate the Senate three decades after it was abolished in the wake of then-President Alberto Fujimori’s decision to dissolve the entire legislature.

title: Trump Challenges Biden to Debate After Jilting Republican Rivals
description: Donald Trump challenged President Joe Biden to debate after refusing to attend the same forums with his Republican primary challengers, a change in attitude that coincides with the effective start of the 2024 general election.

title: Hunt Draws Election Battle Lines With Cuts to Spending and Taxes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt handed millions of British workers a £10 billion ($12.7 billion) a year tax cut paid for by stealing Labour’s flagship policies and squeezing public services as he drew political battle lines for the upcoming election.

title: Jeremy Hunt Extends Child Benefit and Vows to Reform an ‘Unfair’ System
description: Almost half a million more families will be able to claim child-care benefits after UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt changed the income threshold at which it begins to disappear.

title: Xi Calls on ‘Patriots’ to Step Up Taiwan Anti-Independence Fight
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping called for the mobilization of “patriots” in Taiwan and abroad to fend off pro-independence efforts on the island, in a meeting tied to China’s highest profile annual political gathering.

title: Violent Gangs Threaten Civil War as Haiti PM Faces Call to Quit
description: Haiti Prime Minister Ariel Henry is being pressured to quit or present a plan for a new government, as gang leaders who have unleashed deadly violence tighten their grip on the country and threaten civil war.

title: Supreme Court Schedules Trump Immunity Argument for April 25
description: The US Supreme Court said it will hear arguments April 25 on Donald Trump’s bid for immunity from criminal prosecution in a case that threatens to delay his election-interference trial until after the November election.

title: Biden’s Naming of Podesta as Top Climate Diplomat Probed by GOP
description: Congressional Republicans are probing President Joe Biden’s decision to name John Podesta to replace John Kerry as his top climate diplomat, accusing the White House of circumventing the law in appointing him without going through the Senate confirmation process.

title: Serbia’s Vucic Says Prime Minister to Step Down in Reshuffle
description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said Ana Brnabic will step down as prime minister to become parliamentary speaker after leading the government for almost seven years.

title: Democrat Dean Phillips Ends Long-Shot Challenge to Biden
description: US Representative Dean Phillips suspended his presidential campaign, ending his long-shot campaign to challenge President Joe Biden for the Democratic Party’s nomination.

title: Congress to Vote on Raising Security Funds for Convention Cities
description: Chicago and Milwaukee, the host cities for this summer’s Democratic and Republican conventions, are expected to receive a combined $150 million in federal dollars to spend on security for the events.

title: Getting More Aid to Gaza Shouldn’t Be This Difficult
description: Supplies to avert famine and disease are an issue the US must demand of Israel, not request.

title: Lula Takes Wait-and-See Stand on Fairness of Venezuela’s Election
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva urged his global counterparts not to cast doubt on the fairness of Venezuela’s upcoming presidential election, saying they should wait until it occurs to assess its democratic legitimacy.

title: Schumer Calls on FTC to Investigate Wave of Oil Company Mergers
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer called on the Federal Trade Commission to open a full investigation into a wave of acquisitions in the oil and gas industry, arguing that the consolidation threatens competition and could lead to higher prices.

title: US Weighs Tapping Army Funds for Ukraine as Aid Bill Stalls
description: The Biden administration is weighing whether it can tap around $200 million in US Army funding to provide Ukraine immediate support as a larger aid package remains stalled in Congress, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Hunt Plays it Safe: The Readout With Allegra Stratton
description: Jeremy Hunt, the famously safe pair of hands, appears to still be safe. The more outlandish ideas trailed by the chancellor before today’s Budget — cutting an already tight increase in spending and full-fat old fashioned tax cuts — in the end were swerved.

title: Houthi-Sunk Ship Seen as Likely Cause of Severed Red Sea Cables
description: The anchor of a cargo ship that was attacked by Houthi militants was the most likely cause of damage to three telecommunications cables in the Red Sea in late February, according to a subsea cable trade group that includes companies operating in the region.

title: Peru’s Boluarte Appoints Lawyer Adrianzen as New Prime Minister
description: Peru’s President Dina Boluarte swore in lawyer Gustavo Lino Adrianzen as her new prime minister after his predecessor resigned amid a scandal over leaked tapes.

title: Here Are the Key UK Budget Measures Announced by Jeremy Hunt
description: Jeremy Hunt’s UK budget decisions on Wednesday amounted to a pre-election giveaway that in the Chancellor of the Exchequer’s words “put this country back on the path to lower taxes.”

title: Macron’s Government Warns of Harsher Spending Cuts Next Year
description: The French government will likely have to find significantly greater savings than previously expected in 2025 even after rushing through a round of cuts this year to meet its deficit reduction targets, Budget Minister Thomas Cazenave said.

title: Musk Says He Won’t Donate to Either Presidential Candidate
description: Elon Musk signaled he won’t donate money to likely Republican nominee Donald Trump or President Joe Biden, downplaying expectations after a meeting with the GOP candidate earlier this week.

title: Ukraine’s Allies Line Up Funds for 800,000 Artillery Shells
description: Ukraine’s allies have lined up nearly all the funding required for a Czech-led initiative to purchase hundreds of thousands of artillery rounds, according to a government official familiar with the arrangements.

title: McConnell Endorses Donald Trump as GOP Resistance Collapses
description: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell endorsed Donald Trump in the 2024 election, an awkward embrace marking the final capitulation of the party’s establishment to the former president.

title: UK Lifts Tax on Premium, Business and First Class Air Fares
description: The UK will ramp up taxes on premium flying, Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said Wednesday, in a move that will affect holidaymakers who have upgraded beyond economy fares since the pandemic, as well as business travelers.

title: Haley Suspends 2024 Bid, Making Trump Presumptive GOP Nominee
description: Former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley says she is suspending her campaign for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Czech Billionaire Wants to Help Ukraine Produce More Ammunition
description: One of Europe’s biggest arms manufacturers is offering to help Ukraine ramp up its own production of heavy ammunition as the country struggles to repel the Russian invasion amid dwindling western aid.

title: Russia's Crude Exports Slump as Strong Winds Batter Pacific Port
description: Tankers were prevented from mooring at the Kozmino terminal for several days

title: Egypt Gets Breakthrough IMF Deal to Lift Loan Size to $8 Billion
description: Egypt agreed with the International Monetary Fund on increasing its rescue program to $8 billion, the culmination of efforts that included a massive devaluation and an interest-rate hike.

title: Powell in the US House
description: Jerome Powell Photographer: Saul Loeb/AFP

title: Swedish Leader Heads to Washington as NATO Accession Nears
description: Sweden’s Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson departed to Washington on Wednesday, after the Nordic country cleared all hurdles to become a full-fledged member of NATO.

title: Haley Won Over Billionaires and GOP’s Old Guard But Couldn’t Crack Trump’s Base
description: Nikki Haley’s Super Tuesday trouncing by Donald Trump amounted to a repudiation not just of the former South Carolina governor, but of the billionaire donors and traditional Republicans who saw her candidacy as a last chance to reclaim their hold on the party.

title: Argentines Put $2.3 Billion Into Banks, Signaling Faith in Milei
description: Argentines have deposited more than $2.3 billion into dollar-denominated local bank accounts since President Javier Milei took office Dec. 10, reflecting incipient optimism about his government.

title: Two Senators Criticize Fed Watchdog Over Internal Trading Report
description: Two US senators criticized the Federal Reserve’s internal watchdog for his investigation into trading by Fed officials during the pandemic, saying he failed to hold agency officials accountable or take steps to prevent similar scandals in the future.

title: Hunt Says UK Growth Better-Than-Expected in Boost for Tories
description: Jeremy Hunt said UK growth is due to be stronger than previously forecast by the budget watchdog, a boost for the ruling Conservative Party ahead of an election expected later this year.

title: Italy’s State Selloff Won’t Shrink Its Debt Mountain, Scope Says
EU Moves Toward Hitting China With Tariffs on Electric Vehicles
description: The European Union is moving closer to imposing additional tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles entering the bloc, citing new proof that the government in Beijing is providing illegal financial support for the industry.

title: Turkey Walks Tightrope Between US and Russia in Diplomacy Puzzle
description: Turkey is working to improve military relations with the US even while maintaining ties with Russia, in part by starting to comply with financial sanctions against Moscow.

title: Australia Will Pay Pension Contributions on Paid Parental Leave
description: The Australian government will make long-awaited changes to pay pension contributions for workers who take paid parental leave, the latest move by the center-left Labor government to address gender inequality in the country’s workforce.

title: Nikki Haley Ends 2024 Bid, Setting Up Trump-Biden Rematch
description: Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley is ending her campaign, ceding the nomination to Donald Trump and setting up a rematch of the 2020 election against President Joe Biden, the Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday.

title: Europe’s New Security Nightmare Is Food Supply
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Hungary’s Orban Wants to Discuss Ukraine With Trump in Florida
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban wants to discuss how to end Russia’s war on Ukraine this week with former US President Donald Trump in Florida, Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto said.

title: Trump’s Wins Close the Final Chapter on Reagan Republicans
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. In this special edition, Bloomberg Businessweek columnist Joshua Green looks at where the Republican Party stands after the Super Tuesday primaries. The regular newsletter will return this afternoon. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Biden Team Sees Disaffected Voters As Key to 2024 Rebound
description: President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign believes disaffected voters who oppose Donald Trump could be key to reversing the incumbent president’s fortunes in November’s general election.

title: Trump’s Triumph Writes an Epitaph for Reagan Republican Party
description: Donald Trump’s sweep through Tuesday’s Republican primaries effectively ends Nikki Haley’s presidential hopes, at least for this year. More broadly, it erases any lingering doubt that a Republican Party long-defined by allegiance to Ronald Reagan’s world view has been transformed into a party singularly dominated by Trump’s.

title: Netherlands Seeks to Prevent ASML Expansion Abroad, Report Says
description: The ASML Holding NV headquarters and factory in Veldhoven, Netherlands. Photographer: Peter Boer/Bloomberg

title: Struggling German Economy Gets ‘Ray of Hope’ as Exports Jump
description: German exports jumped at the beginning of the year, a sign that the industrial weakness that’s weighed on Europe’s biggest economy might be easing.

title: Californians Split on $6.4 Billion Bond to Fight Homelessness
description: California voters are split in early returns on a ballot measure to borrow $6.4 billion to fund new housing and expand treatment programs for unhoused people, particularity those struggling with mental illness and addiction.

title: Russian Drone Attack Cuts Power in Western Ukraine Region
description: Russia launched its biggest drone attack on Ukraine in more than three weeks, with damage to energy infrastructure cutting power for 14,000 consumers in parts of the western Khmelnytskyi region.

title: Australia, Asean Urge Restraint Amid Tensions in South China Sea
description: Australia and Southeast Asian nations warned against actions that “endanger peace” in the South China Sea and called for self-restraint, a day after a collision between Chinese and Philippines vessels sparked new tensions in the contested waterway.

title: Egypt Devalues Currency by More Than 30% After Big Rate Hike
description: Egypt devalued its currency, allowing it to weaken around 35%, following a massive interest-rate hike by a country embroiled in its worst economic crisis in decades.

title: China Defends 5% Goal, Vows Vigorous Effort to Grow Economy
description: China’s top economic officials defended the nation’s plan to grow the economy by around 5% this year, one day after the ambitious target was met with skepticism by some economists due to a perceived lack of sufficient policy support.

title: Budget Day 2024: Hunt Delivers Fiscal Plan With Focus on Tax Cuts
description: Jeremy Hunt on March 6. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg

title: Hong Kong Consultation on Security Law Cited Communication Apps
description: The Hong Kong government’s document summarizing recent public consultations on proposed domestic security legislation included suggestions that some popular messaging apps be prohibited, though authorities stopped short of endorsing that view.

title: Heads of China's Biggest Agencies, Including Central Bank, Gather to Discuss Key Policy Details
description: BEIJING, CHINA - MARCH 05: People attend the opening of the Second Session of the 14th National People's Congress at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China, on March 5, 2024. (Photo by Stringer/Anadolu via Getty Images)

title: Walker, McDowell Head to Runoff in North Carolina House Primary
description: Mark Walker and Addison McDowell are heading to a runoff in the Republican primary for North Carolina’s redrawn 6th Congressional District, AP reports.

title: Trump-Backed Brandon Gill Wins Texas House Primary
description: Brandon Gill won the Republican primary for the 26th Congressional District in Texas, the AP projected.

title: Key Takeaways From Super Tuesday Primaries in US
description: Here are the key takeaways from the Super Tuesday round of primaries, when 15 states and one territory selected their major party nominees for the 2024 general election. Click here for our TOPLive blog.

title: Europe Is Wargaming a Food Crisis
description: A group of people came together last month to tackle the worst-case scenario for one of the best-fed regions in the world.

title: Trump, Musk Attack Legal Migrant Program Meant to Calm Border
description: Former President Donald Trump joined Elon Musk in criticizing US officials for the arrival of 320,000 migrants last year, referring to a program for legal, vetted applicants that was designed to deter people from crossing the border.

title: Moore Wins Republican Primary for Alabama House Seat
description: Rep. Barry Moore won the Republican primary for Alabama’s 1st Congressional District, AP projects.

title: Democrat Schiff, GOP’s Garvey Advance in California Senate Race
description: Democrat Adam Schiff and Republican Steve Garvey advance to the November election for California Senate, MSNBC and CBS projected, defeating a crowded field of candidates in the race for the late Dianne Feinstein’s seat.

title: Buckhout Wins Republican Nomination in North Carolina House Race
description: Laurie Buckhout, a retired US Army colonel, won the Republican primary in the race for North Carolina’s 1st Congressional District, AP reports.

title: Voters and Candidates Pivot to General Election as Trump Wins GOP Primaries
description: Today on the Big Take DC podcast: After voters in 15 states hit the polls in the biggest primary day in the 2024 election cycle, the race is on. Host Saleha Mohsin and politics editor Mario Parker unpack what Biden and Trump have going for them - and against them.

title: Haley Secures Super Tuesday Win Over Trump in Vermont
description: Republican Nikki Haley upset Donald Trump in Vermont, securing her second victory of the presidential primary on a night when the frontrunner otherwise barreled toward his party’s nomination.

title: Allred Wins Texas Senate Democratic Primary, Will Face Cruz
description: Colin Allred won the Democratic Senate primary, NBC and ABC said, besting a crowded field of candidates to take on Republican Sen. Ted Cruz in November.

title: South Korean Police Question Key People in Doctors’ Walkout
description: South Korean police are set to question key figures in a walkout by thousands of doctors who oppose a plan to increase medical school enrollments as the government prepares punishments for those who defy orders to return to work.

title: Newsom Donor to Boost Pay at His Panera Franchises After Bill Controversy
description: Panera Bread locations in California owned by billionaire Greg Flynn will raise base pay to $20 hour when the state’s fast-food wage law comes into effect next month, regardless of whether the chain needs to comply with the new requirement.

title: Peru Prime Minister Otarola Resigns Post After Audio Leaked
description: Peruvian Prime Minister Alberto Otarola resigned his post Tuesday while defending himself against corruption allegations, depriving President Dina Boluarte of a key political ally.

title: Lawmakers Seek to Restore Antitrust Funding to Spending Bill
description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers are urging colleagues to reinstate funding to the Justice Department’s antitrust enforcers in the spending bill set to be considered by Congress this week.

title: Trump on Cusp of Republican Nomination With Super Tuesday Wins
description: Donald Trump won the Republican presidential primaries in Virginia, Tennessee and North Carolina, networks projected, as he barrels closer toward his party’s nomination.

title: Musk Meets With Trump as Former President Seeks 2024 Donors
description: Donald Trump and billionaire Elon Musk met on Sunday as the Republican presidential frontrunner is seeking to woo donors to fund his cash-strapped political operation, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Singapore’s Iswaran Released From Melbourne Hospital, ST Reports
description: Singapore’s former transport minister S. Iswaran, who is facing corruption charges, was hospitalized for respiratory illness in Melbourne and was subsequently discharged on March 5, the Straits Times reported, without citing where it got the information.

title: There’s a New Financial Crisis Brewing in Uninsurable US Homes
description: “Last resort” state home insurance programs are taking on trillions of dollars in risk as private insurers pull out of the US markets most susceptible to climate disaster, from California to Florida.
